intro: Ampelocissus galeottiana, commonly known as the rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible fig-like fruits. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
